body: Thank you @fkiraly . I shall begin work on this. And make a draft shortly

issue.title: re-factoring existing forecasters - Stacking,  Multiplexer, Ensemble and TransformedTarget Forecasters

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Reference : https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/955
We need to slowly re-factor all forecasters to be compliant with the new interface (see PR #912). i.e., no overrides of fit etc and descendant classes only implementing core logic, while the BaseForecaster implements check etc logic.

Currently this is running due to various downwards compatibility workarounds, which should be removed once all forecasters are ready (in "no-override" state)

The forecasters that still need a downstream refactor are:

  

- [ ] NaiveForecasters
- [x] EnsembleForecaster
- [x] MultiplexForecaster
- [x] TransformedTargetForecaster
- [ ] _Reducer and related code
- [x] StackingForecaster
- [ ] ForecastingGridSearchCV, RandomizedGridSearchCV, and BaseGridSearch
- [ ] OnlineEnsembleForecaster and descendants
- [ ] _PmdArimaAdapter and descendants ARIMA, AutoARIMA
- [ ] BATS, TBATS, and _Tbatsadapter
- [ ] _StatsModelAdapter and descendants AutoETS, ExponentialSmoothing, ThetaForecaster
- [ ] HCrystalBallForecaster
- [ ] Prophet and _ProphetAdapter
- [ ] PolynomialTrendForecaster

body:
For convenience, I'm adding a recipe here:

* go through all the public methods, `fit`, `predict`, etc, and change them to the new private version `_fit`, `_predict`, etc
* remove input checks (e.g., `check_X`) and output operations (e.g., set cutoff) from the private version; make sure these are already all present in the `BaseForecaster`.
* if there's an input or output check/operation that looks like it should be in `BaseForecaster` but isn't, add a note to your PR and make it very explicit; consider adding it to `BaseForecaster` but make sure @mloning and @fkiraly are aware of such a change.
* make sure all the tests pass. Don't change any of the tests.
* if there's an inheritance tree (not just a single class) downstream from `BaseForecaster`, make sure you do the above for all nodes in the inheritance tree
* remove instances of `_SktimeForecaster`, `_OptionalForecastingHorizonMixin`, `_RequiredForecastingHorizonMixin` as parents, replace these by `BaseForecaster`
* add `_tags` depending on properties of the forecaster, and which mixin was removed. If the estimator previously inherited from `_OptionalForecastingHorizonMixin`, it should get the tag `"requires-fh-in-fit": False`; if it inherited from `_RequiredForecastingHorizonMixin`, it should get the tag `"requires-fh-in-fit": True`; if the other tags are unclear, use the (conservative) values from the extension template.
FYI, @thayeylolu - not sure whether youÂ´ve seen the "recipe" for the refactor.
@fkiraly @mloning This is easily something i could help with next week (and in the weeks after that). Let me know if that is sensible

I think @thayeylolu might be done by then already ðŸ˜ƒ
